oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Christian Advocate editors
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Composite print of Christian Advocate editors, 1836-1941, shown on the cover of the publication.

The Nashville Christian Advocate was the official paper of the Tennessee Conference and served as the weekly newspaper of the Methodist Episcopal Church. Originally named the Southwestern Christian Advocate, by 1846 the name changed to the Nashville Christian Advocate. At the time in the South, it was one of the leading Methodist newspapers. The church's publishing house was in Nashville, and this resulted in the name eventually changing to just the Christian Advocate.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Nashville Christian advocate
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McTyeire, Holland Nimmons, 1824-1889; Fitzgerald, O. P. (Oscar Penn), 1829-1911; Hoss, E. E. (Elijah Embree), 1849-1919; Winton, George B. (George Beverly), 1861-1938; Ivey, Thomas N. (Thomas Neal), 1860-1923; Smith, Alfred F., 1869-1962; King, William P. (William Peter), 1871-1957; M'Ferrin, John B. (John Berry), 1807-1887
